maml:description.maml:para: Convert PowerShell object to XML.
Convert object to XML.
Object to convert to Xml.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Converts PowerShell object to Xml with root node named Object.

maml:description.maml:para: Converts record set object to XML.
Converts record set object to XML.
Input object.
XML Root node name.
Input object.
XML Root node name.

command:example.maml:title: --------- Example 1 ---------
command:example.dev:code: $RecordSet = Get-SqlClientDataSet -ServerInstance . -DatabaseName master -SqlCommandText 'SELECT * FROM sys.tables;' -OutputAs DataRow ConvertTo-RecordXML -InputObject $RecordSet -RootNodeName "Records"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Converts record set object to Xml with root node named Records.

command:example.maml:title: --------- Example 2 ---------
command:example.dev:code: Get-SqlClientDataSet -ServerInstance . -DatabaseName master -SqlCommandText 'SELECT * FROM sys.tables;' -OutputAs DataRow | ConvertTo-RecordXML -RootNodeName "Records"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Converts record set object to Xml with root node named Records.

Specifies attachment object.
Specifies the address from which the mail is sent. Enter a name (optional) and email address, such as Name<someone@example.com>.

Specifies the priority of the email message.
Specifies the reply to address where replies will be sent. Enter names (optional) and the email address, such as Name<someone@example.com>.
Specifies the method used for delivery.
Specifies an alternate port on the SMTP server. The default value is 25, which is the default SMTP port.
Specifies the name of the SMTP server that sends the email message.

command:example.maml:title: --------- Example 1: Send email message using SMTP server ---------
command:example.dev:code: Send-MailToolMessage -MailFrom "Joe<joe@example.com>" -MailTo "John<john@example.com>" -Subject "Test Email" -Body "This is a test message." -SmtpServer mail.example.com

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sends email message through SMTP server.

command:example.maml:title: --------- Example 2: Send email message using pickup folder ---------
command:example.dev:code: Send-MailToolMessage -MailFrom "Joe<joe@example.com>" -MailTo "John<john@example.com>" -Subject "Test Email" -Body "This is a test message." -SmtpDeliveryMethod "SpecifiedPickupDirectory" -PickupDirectoryPath "C:\inetpub\mailroot\pickup"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sends email message via drop folder.
